adjective.description: Of, relating to, or characteristic of the Peak District in Derbyshire.

origin: Mid 18th century; earliest use found in William Ellis (c1700–1758), agriculturist and writer. From peak + -ish<br>mid 19th century; earliest use found in Benjamin Smart (d. 1872), elocutionist and grammarian. Probably alteration of peaky, with suffix substitution.
